subject: Cybersecurity
title: Password Managers: One Password to Rule Them All
description: A short lesson to help you apply Password Managers: One Password to Rule Them All.

hook.text: The average person has 100+ online accounts. Nobody can remember 100 unique, strong passwords without help.

buildup.text: Password managers generate and store unique random passwords for every site, locked behind one master password.

discovery.text: Using a password manager means a breach on one site doesn't compromise all your other accounts â€” no password reuse.

twist.text: LastPass was breached in 2022. Encrypted vaults were stolen, and weak master passwords could be cracked offline.

climax.text: Password managers are still the best practical option, but they create a single point of failure that must be.

punchline.text: One password protects all your passwords. Choose it wisely.
